artist: Artist: Designer: Claude Gillot; Artist: Etcher: Nicolas Henri Tardieu
creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
description: two men in a room with shelves of books and an arched doorway at left; man in robes and hat looks at a book at center; second man holds a book up and has his PL foot on a stool at right
inscription:
in plate, lower left: C. Gillot in.
in plate, lower right: N. Tardieu Scul.
markings: fragmentary watermark: large chain-encircled IHS surmounted by a cross
text: This is one of 168 illustrations for Houdart de la Motte's "Fables nouvelles" (Paris, 1719), most of which were etched by Claude Gillot. This impression is not taken from the book, but was printed and sold separately. Houdart modeled his work on the fables of Jean de La Fontaine. Gillot's illustrations are considered the introduction of Rococo miniatures and vignettes to book illustration.
title: Les deux livres, pg. 235 from "Fables nouvelles"
